term.name: Randianism
term.source: From the name of the Russian-American novelist and philosopher Ayn Rand (1905-1982).
term.def: A philosophical movement in 20th-century America that combined &objectivism; in metaphysics, &conceptualism; in epistemology, &individualism; in ethics, &libertarianism; in politics, and a kind of heroic &symbolism; in aesthetics; called by its adherents Objectivism (with a capital 'O').
